servinfo.title: Compression Check
servinfo.ptxt: Check compression pressure on all 4 cylinders as follows:

attention3.ptxt: After warming up engine, place transmission gear shift lever in “Neutral” (shift selector lever to “P” range for A/T model), and set parking brake and block drive wheels.

s1.ptxt: Disconnect fuel injector wire harness at the coupler.
Install special tool (Compression gauge) into spark plug hole.
Disengage clutch (to lighten starting load on engine) for M/T vehicle, and depress accelerator pedal all the way to make throttle fully open.
Crank engine with fully charged battery, and read the highest pressure on compression gauge.

item.ptxt: For measuring compression pressure, crank engine at least 250 rpm by using fully charged battery.
If measuring compression pressure is lower than limit value, check installation condition of special tool. If it is properly.

spec.title: Compression pressure
spec.ptxt: Max. difference between any two cylinders: 100 kPa (1.0 kg/cm², 14.2 psi)

s1.ptxt: Carry out Steps 8) through 10) on each cylinder to obtain 4 readings.
After checking, install spark plugs (2) and ignition coils (1).
Connect injector wire harness at coupler.
